registers.name: Chip Version
documentation: This register is read-only and gives the chip identification number: 0x8431 (1000 0100 0001 0001).

registers.name: Row Start
documentation: First row to be read out-default = 0x000C (12). Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Column Start
documentation: First column to be read out-default = 0x0014 (20).
Register value must be an even number. Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Row Size
documentation: Window height (number of rows - 1)-default = 0x03FF (1023).
Minimum value for 0x03 = 0x0002. Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Column Size
documentation: Window width (number of columns - 1)-default = 0x04FF (1279).
Register value must be an odd number.
Minimum value for 0x04 = 0x0003. Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Horizontal Blanking
documentation: Horizontal Blanking-default = 0x0009 (9 pixels). Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Vertical Blanking
documentation: Vertical Blanking-default = 0x0019 (25 rows). Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Output Control
documentation: This register controls various features of the output format for the sensor. Data format: 0000 0000 0d00 00dd

bits.name: Synchronize changes
documentation: Synchronize changes (copied to Reg0xF1, bit1).
0 = normal operation. Update changes to registers that affect image brightness (integration time,
integration delay, gain, horizontal blanking and vertical blanking, window size, row/column skip or
row mirror) at the next frame boundary. The "frame boundary" is 8 row_times before the rising
edge of FRAME_VALID. (If "Show Dark Rows" is set, it will be coincident with the rising edge of
FRAME_VALID.)
1 = do not update any changes to these settings until this bit is returned to "0."

bits.name: Chip Enable
documentation: Chip Enable (copied to Reg0xF1, bit0).
1 = normal operation.
0 = stop sensor readout. When this is returned to "1", sensor readout restarts at the starting row in
a new frame. The digital power consumption can then also be reduced to less than 5uA by turning
off the master clock.

bits.name: Use Test Data
documentation: Use Test Data.
When set, a test pattern will be output instead of the sampled image from the sensor array. The
value sent to the DOUT[9:0] pins will alternate between the Test Data register (Reg0x32) in even
columns and the inverse of the Test Data register for odd columns. The output "image" will have
the same width, height, and frame rate as it would otherwise have. No digital processing (gain or
offset) is applied to the data. When clear (the default), sampled pixel values are output normally

registers.name: Shutter Width
documentation: Number of rows of integration-default = 0x0419 (1049). Data format: 00dd dddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Frame Restart
documentation: Setting bit 0 to "1" of Reg0x0B will cause the sensor to abandon the readout of the current frame
and restart from the first row. This register automatically resets itself to 0x0000 after the frame
restart. The first frame after this event is considered to be a "bad frame" (see description for
Reg0x20, bit0).
Data format: 0000 0000 0000 000d

registers.name: Shutter Delay
documentation: Shutter delay-default = 0x0000 (0). This is the number of master clocks times four that the timing
and control logic waits before asserting the reset for a given row. Data format: 0000 0ddd dddd dddd

registers.name: Reset
documentation: This register is used to reset the sensor to its default, power-up state. To put the MT9M001 in reset
mode first write a "1" into bit 0 of this register, then write a "0" into bit 0 to resume operation.
Data format: 0000 0000 0000 000d

registers.name: Read Options 1
documentation: In read mode 1, this register is used to control many aspects of the readout of the sensor. Data format: 1000 dddd 00dd dd00

bits.name: Column Skip 4
documentation: Column Skip 4-default is 0 (disable). 1 = enable.

bits.name: Row Skip 4
documentation: Row Skip 4-default is 0 (disable). 1 = enable.

bits.name: Column Skip 8
documentation: Column Skip 8-default is 0 (disable). 1 = enable.

bits.name: Row Skip 8
documentation: Row Skip 8-default is 0 (disable). 1 = enable.

bits.name: Snapshot Mode
documentation: Snapshot Mode-default is 0 (continuous mode).
1 = enable (wait for TRIGGER; TRIGGER can come from outside signal (TRIGGER pin on the sensor)
or from serial interface register restart, i.e. programming a "1" to bit 0 of Reg0x0B

bits.name: STROBE Enable
documentation: STROBE Enable-default is 0 (no STROBE signal).
1 = enable STROBE (signal output from the sensor during the time all rows are integrating. See
STROBE width for more information).

bits.name: STROBE Width
documentation: STROBE Width-default is 0 (STROBE signal width at minimum length, 1 row of integration time,
prior to line valid going HIGH)
1 = extend STROBE width (STROBE signal width extends to entire time all rows are integrating).

bits.name: Strobe Override
documentation: Strobe Override-default is 0 (STROBE signal created by digital logic).
1 = override STROBE signal (STROBE signal is set HIGH when this bit is set, LOW when this bit is set
LOW. It is assumed that STROBE enable is set to "0" if STROBE override is being used).

registers.name: Read Options 2
documentation: This register is used to control many aspects of the readout of the sensor. Data format: dd01 0dd1 d00d d10d

bits.name: No bad frames
documentation: No bad frames-1 = output all frames (including bad frames).
0 (default) = only output good frames. A bad frame is defined as the first frame following a change
to: window size or position, horizontal blanking, row or column skip, or mirroring.

bits.name: Column skip
documentation: Column skip-1= read out two columns, and then skip two columns (for example, col 0, col 1, col 4, col 5,...
0 = normal readout (default)

bits.name: Row skip
documentation: Row skip-1 = read out two rows, and then skip two rows (for example, row 0, row 1, row 4, row 5...).
0 = normal readout (default).

bits.name: Flip Row
documentation: Flip Row-1 = readout starting 1 row later (alternate color pair)
0 (default) = normal readout.

bits.name: Continuous LINE_VALID
documentation: 1 = "Continuous" LINE_VALID (continue producing LINE_VALID during vertical blanking).

bits.name: Continuous LINE_VALID XOR FRAME_VALID
documentation: 1 = LINE_VALID = "Continuous" LINE_VALID XOR FRAME_VALID.
0 = LINE_VALID determined by bit 9.

bits.name: raw data output mode
documentation: the black rows can also be read out by setting the sensor to raw data output mode.

bits.name: Mirror Row
documentation: Mirror Row-1 = read out from bottom to top (upside down).
0 (default) = normal readout (top to bottom).

registers.name: Even Row, Even Column gain
documentation: Even row, even column-default = 0x08 (8) = 1x gain.
Data format: 0000 0000 0ddd dddd

registers.name: Odd Row, Even Column gain
documentation: Odd row, even column-default = 0x08 (8) = 1x gain.
Data format: 0000 0000 0ddd dddd

registers.name: Even Row, Odd Column gain
documentation: Even row, odd column-default = 0x08 (8) = 1x gain.
Data format: 0000 0000 0ddd dddd

registers.name: Odd Row, Odd Column gain
documentation: Odd row, odd column-default = 0x08 (8) = 1x gain.
Data format: 0000 0000 0ddd dddd

registers.name: Test Data
documentation: The value used to produce a test pattern in "Use Test Data" mode (Reg0x07 bit 6).
Data format: 0000 dddd dddd dd00

registers.name: Global Gain
documentation: Global gain-default = 0x08 (8) = 1x gain. This register can be used to set all four gains at once.
Data format: 0000 0000 0ddd dddd

registers.name: Cal Threshold
documentation: Data format: dddd dddd d0dd dddd

bits.name: Thres_lo
documentation: Thres_lo-Lower threshold for black level in ADC LSBs-default = 000100.

bits.name: override automatic Thres_hi and Thres_lo adjust
documentation: 1 = override automatic Thres_hi and Thres_lo adjust (Thres_hi always = bits 14:8; Thres_lo always = bits 5:0).
Default = 0 = Automatic Thres_hi and Thres_lo adjustment.

bits.name: Thres_hi
documentation: Thres_hi-Maximum allowed black level in ADC LSBs (default = Thres_lo + 5)
Black level maximum is set to this value when bit 7 = 1; black level maximum is reset to this value
after every black level average restart if bit 15 = 1 and bit 7 = 0.

bits.name: No gain dependence
documentation: 1 = Thres_lo is set by the programmed value of bits 5:0, Thres_hi is reset to the programmed value
(bits 14:8) after every black level average restart.
0 = Thres_lo and Thres_hi are set automatically, as described above.

registers.name: Even Row, Even Column analog offset
documentation: Even row, even column-analog offset correction value for even row, even column, bits 0:7 sets
magnitude, bit 8 set sign.
0 = positive; 1 = negative.
two's complement, if bit 8 = 1, Offset = bits [0:7] - 256.
Data format: 0000 000d dddd dddd

registers.name: Odd Row, Odd Column analog offset
documentation: Odd row, odd column-analog offset correction value for odd row, odd column, bits 0:7 sets
magnitude, bit 8 set sign.
0 = positive; 1 = negative.
two's complement, if bit 8 = 1, Offset = bits [0:7] - 256.
Data format: 0000 000d dddd dddd

registers.name: Cal Ctrl
documentation: Data format: d00d d100 1001 1ddd

bits.name: Manual override of black level correction
documentation: Manual override of black level correction.
1 = override automatic black level correction with programmed values.
0 = normal operation (default).

bits.name: disable black level correction
documentation: disable black level correction (Offset Correction Voltage = 0.0V).

bits.name: apply black level calibration continuously
documentation: 0 = apply black level calibration during ADC operation only (default).
1 =  apply black level calibration continuously.

bits.name: do not reset the upper threshold after a black level recalculation sweep
documentation: 1 = do not reset the upper threshold after a black level recalculation sweep.
0 = reset the upper threshold after a black level recalculation sweep (default).

bits.name: start a new running digitally filtered average for the black level
documentation: 1 = start a new running digitally filtered average for the black level (this is internally reset to "0"
immediately), and do a rapid sweep to find the new starting point.
0 = normal operation (default).

bits.name: do not perform the rapid black level sweep on new gain settings
documentation: 1 = do not perform the rapid black level sweep on new gain settings.
0 = normal operation.

registers.name: Even Row, Odd Column analog offset
documentation: Even row, odd column-analog offset correction value for even row, odd column, bits 0:7 sets
magnitude, bit 8 set sign.
0 = positive; 1 = negative.
two's complement, if bit 8 = 1, Offset = bits [0:7] - 256.
Data format: 0000 000d dddd dddd

registers.name: Odd Row, Even Column analog offset
documentation: Odd row, even column-analog offset correction value for odd row, even column, bits 0:7 sets
magnitude, bit 8 set sign.
0 = positive; 1 = negative.
two's complement, if bit 8 = 1, Offset = bits [0:7] - 256.
Data format: 0000 000d dddd dddd

registers.name: Chip Enable
documentation: Mirrors the functionality of Reg0x07 bit1 (Chip Enable).
1 = normal operation.
0 = stop sensor readout; when this is returned to "1"
sensor readout restarts at the starting row in
a new frame.
Data format: 0000 0000 0000 00dd
